articles.author: Carolina Mandl, Herbert Lash
articles.description: U.S. stocks ended lower on Thursday after news that the Bank of Japan will allow long-term interest rates to rise sent U.S. yields higher, snapping the longest winning streak for the Dow since 1987.
articles.title: Wall Street closes down, Dow snaps longest winning streak since 1987

articles.author: Luc Cohen
articles.description: The decision by U.S. prosecutors on Wednesday to drop a campaign finance charge against Sam Bankman-Fried may keep his trial focused on what the government considers his main crime: stealing billions of dollars from cryptocurrency customers at his now-bankrupt FTX exchange.
articles.title: Bankman-Fried campaign finance charge dropped, lessening trial's political focus

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The owner of Westfield malls is looking to cash in on shopper traffic by charging brands to be featured on screens and in pop-up spaces, a business it aims to grow.
articles.title: Westfield owner bets on ad sales at its EU shopping malls

articles.author: Dietrich Knauth
articles.description: Bankrupt Lordstown Motors (RIDEQ.PK) must face trial over a rival carmaker's claim that Lordstown vehicles include stolen technology, a U.S. judge ruled Thursday, dealing a blow to the company's hopes for a quick bankruptcy sale.
articles.title: Lordstown Motors stalls on the road to a quick bankruptcy sale

articles.author: Caroline Valetkevitch
articles.description: Shares of home and kitchen product maker Tupperware (TUP.N) extended their sharp, unexplained gains on Thursday, rising about 50% and putting the stock up more than 300% during the last five trading days despite recent concerns about its business.
articles.title: Tupperware's stock extends recent rally, up 300% in 5 trading days

articles.author: Dmitry Zhdannikov, Nidhi Verma
articles.description: A Liberian-flagged oil tanker set sail in May from Russia's Ust-Luga port carrying crude on behalf of a little-known trading company based in Hong Kong. Before the ship had even reached its destination in India, the cargo changed hands.
articles.title: Insight: Obscure traders ship half Russia's oil exports to India, China after sanctions

articles.author: Pete Schroeder
articles.description: U.S. regulators unveiled a sweeping overhaul Thursday that would direct banks to set aside billions more in capital to guard against risk, which was immediately slammed by the industry as "misguided".
articles.title: US regulators propose ordering banks to hold 16% more capital

articles.author: Sarah N. Lynch, Jacqueline Thomsen
articles.description: Donald Trump's attorneys met on Thursday with Justice Department officials investigating the Republican former president's attempts to overturn his 2020 election defeat, said Trump, the target of a Special Counsel investigation.
articles.title: Trump lawyers meet with US special counsel as second indictment looms

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin said on Wednesday that Ukraine had intensified its frontline attacks over the last few days while a Ukrainian official said Kyiv was making slow but steady progress in liberating its territory.
articles.title: Putin says Ukrainian attacks intensify as Kyiv touts steady gains

articles.author: Lucia Mutikani
articles.description: The U.S. economy grew faster than expected in the second quarter as a resilient labor market supported consumer spending, while businesses boosted investment in equipment and built more factories, potentially keeping a much-feared recession at bay.
articles.title: US economy defies recession fears with strong second-quarter performance
